data.title: Ratu Josefa Iloilo
data.meta_description: Ratu Josefa Iloilo was a Fijian statesman who served for nearly a decade as President of his island nation. He came to power in the aftermath of a coup and his tenure was troubled by political unrest
data.text:
Ratu Josefa Iloilo was a Fijian statesman who served for nearly a decade as President of his island nation. He came to power in the aftermath of a coup and his tenure was troubled by political unrest, including another coup which briefly ousted him in 2006. Despite this, he survived to become the world’s oldest head of state, aged 88, at the time of his retirement after a further constitutional crisis in 2009.

He was born Josefa Iloilovatu Uluivuda (in accordance with common local practice he seldom used his surname, while the prefix “Ratu” is a Fijian title indicating chiefly rank). His birthplace, Viseisei, in Vuda District, Ba Province, is said to be the oldest village in Fiji, close to the point at which the
